About the job
About Stackwell

Stackwell Capital is a fintech startup on a mission to eliminate the racial wealth gap by empowering and growing a new community of Black investors. We’ve built an easy-to-use, culturally congruent platform that breaks down the social, emotional and cultural barriers to market entry and guides more members of the Black community into and through the investment process. Our unique app is specifically designed to meet our users where they are and promote inclusion, education and accessibility regardless of an individuals’ background, income or familiarity with the investment process. By helping users enter and stay in the market, Stackwell is helping more people in the Black community build wealth, and in the process, achieve greater agency and control to direct outcomes that matter most in their lives. For more information, visit www.stackwellcapital.com.

About the Role

Stackwell is looking for aspiring leaders with drive, enthusiasm and a strong interest in a career in FinTech to join its two year Analyst Rotational Program. We’re looking for the best and brightest to build the foundation for the company’s future and provide a pipeline of top talent for positions in our Operations, Product and Marketing organizations. Rotating throughout our business units and functions, you will have the opportunity to participate in complex projects that have a significant impact on the business while strengthening the skills necessary to lead in the FinTech industry.

Responsibilities

Within each rotation you will be placed into different teams allowing you to work on a variety of activities, for example:
Perform market research and analysis to help inform the ongoing development and refinement of business and product strategy.
Conduct data analysis to identify areas of opportunity for business process optimization and improvement.
Develop and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) for key business processes.
Support the product experimentation lifecycle, including through hypothesis creation, research, validation and product design.
Execute marketing campaigns to generate qualified leads as sales opportunities within the existing user base and/or net new users.
Provide sales support for strategic partnership opportunities, including the development of sales collateral and other presentation materials.
Conduct and document moderate to complex financial analysis projects for senior leadership to assist strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support the implementation of new initiatives.
Provide operational support to internal teams as needed.

Rotation pathways will depend on various factors, including your career interests, development needs, location, and business demands. Once you have completed the Stackwell Analyst Rotational Program, you will have the opportunity to align yourself with an area of our business based on your interests, capabilities, and business needs.

Qualifications
1-3 years of work experience in banking, finance, consulting, or a general management rotational program.
A bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance, accounting, math, economics, computer science or engineering.
Interest and a real passion for learning about the FinTech industry.
Possess a growth mindset with enthusiasm, and inquisitiveness for the work and a desire to further your own professional development.
Strong interpersonal communication and listening skills, critical writing and thinking skills, an open-minded approach and ability to think on one’s feet.
Ability to cultivate relationships and work collaboratively and cross functionally with all levels of staff and leaders.
Ability to deal with ambiguity, tight deadlines, multiple priorities, and demanding environments.
Capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction and altering priorities.
Attention to detail, highly adaptable, ability to multi-task and effectively meet deadlines.
Ability to effectively use Excel and PowerPoint, and have a technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly.
Ability to think strategically and communicate clearly.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, reporting, presentation and project management skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Working at Stackwell
This position is full time. Stackwell was founded in Boston, but our team works remotely. Work hours can be flexible but covering regular trading hours for the U.S. stock market will be required.
Stackwell is committed to supporting our team members across work and life. As a Stackwell employee, you will receive:
o Competitive salary and equity compensation
o Outstanding benefits (medical, dental, vision, and life)
o 401(k) with employer match
o Unlimited PTO that we encourage you to take
o Ongoing professional growth and team building opportunities

Everyone is welcome at Stackwell. We are an equal opportunity employer who values diversity and inclusion and look for applicants who understand, embrace and thrive in a multicultural world. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About the job
About Dew Wealth Management
Dew Wealth Management is a Fiduciary Investment Advisory Firm that provides “Virtual Family Office” wealth management services to entrepreneurs through a model that is disrupting the investment advisory industry. Our visionary model and elite team of highly entrepreneurial advisors has resulted in an aggressive growth trajectory that Inc. Magazine has recognized as one of the fastest-growing privately held companies in the United States. We have also been lauded by Investment News as one of the “Best Places to Work for Financial Advisors,” and are a “Great Place to Work” certified company.
If you love being challenged by complex problems and are hungry for an opportunity to rapidly advance your skillset and career, Dew Wealth Management offers a collaborative and supportive culture that will invest in your professional development in equal measure to your investments in our clients’ success.

About the Position
Dew Wealth Management is actively seeking a highly analytical, detail-oriented, and experienced Junior Private Market Investment Analyst with a strong focus on vetting private market offerings (including real estate), conducting trades, conducting rigorous due diligence on third-party managers and operators, and assisting in strategy development. The successful candidate will collaborate directly with our Director of Investments, an elite team of advisors, and stakeholders to develop and implement investment strategies that align with our clients’ financial goals and objectives.
Working within a Distributed Workforce
This is a fully remote role. Approximately four times per year, we will pay you to fly out to our headquarters in Scottsdale, AZ to get an opportunity to connect with your colleagues in person and align on quarterly objectives. Beyond that, however, your primary interaction with your colleagues will be through the cloud-based tech stack we leverage to align our distributed workforce, which includes employees across the United States.
Notwithstanding the virtual nature of our model, at present, we are only hiring applicants who reside within the continental United States to minimize HR and tax complexities and to keep our team within four time zones of each other. We are currently unable to hire candidates from AK, HI, or CA.

Key Responsibilities
Perform thorough due diligence on a variety of alternative investments, real estate, and private market offerings, including analyzing financial statements, evaluating market trends, assessing management teams, and understanding property specifics for real estate investments.
Formulate investment theses and recommendations based on meticulous market research, financial analysis, and due diligence findings. Provide insights that directly influence investment decisions in alternative sectors, including real estate.
Actively manage portfolios comprising stocks, bonds, ETFs, and alternative investments, ensuring trades are executed in accordance with established guidelines.
Monitor and analyze the performance of various investments, including alternative investments and real estate holdings. Provide regular updates to the Director of Investments and clients.
Conduct interviews and due diligence with third-party managers, sponsors, and operators. Evaluate their track record, investment strategies, and operational capabilities.
Cultivate and maintain relationships with investment partners, service providers, real estate professionals, trading counterparts, and third-party managers and operators to expand our network and access the best opportunities.
Stay informed about industry trends, regulations, and best practices related to alternative investments, real estate, private market offerings, portfolio management, and third-party manager assessment.
Participate in team meetings, contribute valuable insights, and help shape investment strategies and processes.
Meet regularly with clients to discuss the risks, virtues and cons of private market deals, real estate syndications and investment strategies.
Assist clients and advisors with the development of asset allocation strategy and asset deployment.

Qualifications
To be successful, the ideal candidate will have:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, real estate, or a related field.
Desire to earn advanced designations such as CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst), CAIA (Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst), or CIMA® (Certified Investment Management Analyst).
Experience providing investment analysis, private market due diligence, portfolio management, and executing securities trades.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in financial modeling, stress testing and analysis.
Familiarity reviewing private placement memorandums, performance proformas, private market subscription agreements, and other relevant legal documents.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with internal and external team members, clients, and strategic partners.
Ability to conduct interviews and perform due diligence on third-party managers and operators.
Ability to work independently and as part of a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment.
Strong work ethic and unwavering commitment to excellence.

You Should Apply If You:

You want to play a critical role as a highly regarded team member in a rapidly growing organization on the Inc. 5000.
You are seeking an opportunity to be challenged professionally.
You love being in a small, start-up environment (fast-paced, pivoting work style and all!)
You value a strong and vibrant company culture and seek an organization that does the same.

You Shouldn’t Apply If You:

Enjoy daily/frequent contact with clients.
Are seeking the “traditional” investment advisory approach to asset allocations.
Are seeking commission-based compensation and business development.
Prefer in-person work environments.
Don’t have a desire to be pushed professionally in a fast-paced environment that emphasizes results.

Compensation
Compensation for this role is $80,000 per year, structured as a $65,000 base salary plus a performance bonus, paid semi-annually. Additionally, the firm offers a generous benefits package that includes, among other benefits, fully subsidized healthcare, a 401(k)-matching program, and an Employee Stock Ownership Plan.
